titleproper.value: Guide to the Brooklyn Eagle records <num>1977.226</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-11-05T16:04:27</date>

abstract.value: The Brooklyn Eagle records span the years 1887 to 1955 (bulk dates 1930 to 1955) and primarily covers the last years of publication of the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Eagle</emph> before its bankruptcy in 1955.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Eagle records, 1977.226, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
The collection was found in the trash when the Brooklyn Eagle office closed in December 1963. The collection was formally accessioned in 1963, donor unknown.

In 1938, the newspaper underwent another name change when it became the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Eagle</emph>. Frank D. Schroth bought the paper in 1940 and continued to publish it until 1955 when the <emph render="italic">Eagle </emph>ceased publication during a lengthy strike by the New York Newspaper Guild. Bankruptcy followed. Between 1960 and 1963, the <emph render="italic">Eagle </emph>once again resumed publication, this time as a weekly paper (though for a short time as a daily). The run was short-lived and the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Eagle</emph> office closed in December 1963. In 1996, J. Dozier Hasty, the owner and publisher of Brooklyn Heights Press, purchased the Eagle's name and logo and began to publish the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Daily Eagle & Daily Bulletin</emph>. As of 2011, the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Daily Eagle & Daily Bulletin</emph> remains a daily newspaper, published five days per week.

The Brooklyn Eagle records span the years 1887 to 1955 (bulk dates 1930 to 1955) and measure 1.25 linear feet. The collection primarily covers the last years of publication of the <emph render="italic">Brooklyn Eagle</emph> before its bankruptcy in 1955. Included in the collection are materials relating to the bankruptcy of the Brooklyn Eagle; personnel records, 1955; a Tri-County Publishing Corporation minutes book, 1932 to 1940; Board of Directors minutes and resolutions, 1937 to 1939; contracts and agreements; leases; correspondence; memos; reports; financial records; and deeds, 1887 to 1905. Also included is a 1929 Brooklyn Daily Eagle Summer Resort Directory.
